Title: 6 Brutal Truths That Will Force You to Make Real Friends
Description:
You've let yourself believe a lie about your social life. That's why you're trapped in loneliness.

And that's why I'm here - to break you free with some brutal honesty. It might not be pleasant, but some harsh truths will be good for you.

I'm Dr. Dan, a clinical psychologist and social skills expert. I put this video together to teach you six critical truths that you need to build the friendships that you want and escape loneliness for good.

## What You’ll Discover
- Why “I’m just too awkward” is the lie keeping you stuck  
- How complacency numbs your motivation (and what leprosy can teach us about pain)  
- The dating trap: why real friendships must come first  
- The reality check that nobody’s coming to save your social life  
- How rejection becomes your greatest ally  
- The one regret you’ll have if you don’t start making friends today  

Ready to turn loneliness into lifelong connections? Press play, take notes, and plant the seeds of authentic community now.

---

#makingfriends  #SocialSkills #Loneliness #Friendship #Psychology #brutaltruth #harshtruth

Title: The hidden dilemma in your relationships
Description:
The explore vs exploit dilemma is a key concept in decision making science. It's a dilemma you experience every day without even realizing it - and it plays a big role in your social life and how fulfilling your relationships are.

In this video, clinical psychologist Dr. Dan Wendler explains how you can recognize when you're in an explore vs exploit dilemma. You'll learn how to make the right choice in your friendships, your dating life, or any other place where you need to navigate through this dilemma.

00:00 Why does the explore vs exploit dilemma matter?
00:24 Understanding the explore vs. exploit dilemma
01:40 How to solve the dilemma in your relationships
02:30 Practical applications for your life

#relationshipadvice #socialskills #makingfriends #selfimprovement #decisionmaking

Title: Evolution designed us to die fast; we can change that — Jacob Kimmel
Description:
Jacob Kimmel thinks he can find the transcription factors to reverse aging. We do a deep dive on why this might be plausible and why evolution hasn’t already optimized for longevity. We also talk about why drug discovery has been getting exponentially harder, and what a new platform for biological understanding to speed up progress would look like. As a bonus, we get into the nitty gritty of gene delivery and Jacob’s controversial takes on CAR-T cells. For full disclosure, I am an angel investor in NewLimit. This did not impact my decision to interview Jacob, nor the questions I asked him.

𝐄𝐏𝐈𝐒𝐎𝐃𝐄 𝐋𝐈𝐍𝐊𝐒
* Transcript: https://www.dwarkesh.com/p/jacob-kimmel

* Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/3xUwUYLpjGI3bxsEM114jq?si=mo4FBuI4RoG42PUYYCFUDw

𝐒𝐏𝐎𝐍𝐒𝐎𝐑𝐒
* Hudson River Trading uses deep learning to tackle one of the world's most complex systems: global capital allocation. They have a massive in-house GPU cluster, and they’re constantly adding new racks of B200s to ensure their researchers are never constrained by compute. Explore opportunities at https://hudsonrivertrading.com/dwarkesh

* Google’s Gemini CLI turns ideas into working applications FAST, no coding required. It built a complete podcast post-production tool in 10 minutes, including fully functional backend logic, and the entire build used less than 10% of Gemini’s session context. Check it out on Github now: https://goo.gle/4mw9BNg

To sponsor a future episode, visit https://www.dwarkesh.com/advertise

Title: Making Real Friends as an Autistic Person
Description:
Autistic people struggle to make friends NOT because of our autism...but because we've been taught to go about our social lives in the wrong way. Here's a better way - one that focuses on sharing your gifts with the world, instead of "fixing" yourself.

#AutisticFriends #Autism #actuallyautistic #neurodivergent #friendship #makingfriends #neurodiversity 

00:00 Why most autistic people go about friendship the wrong way
01:21 Focus on your unique gifts
03:04 Find the right people for you
05:38 Putting this strategy into action

Title: Embrace Change & Get Outside Your Comfort Zone Keynote Sizzle Reel - Dr. Wendler & Dr. Shumway
Description:
Book Dr. Wendler & Dr. Shumway to speak at your event - https://www.danielwendler.com/comfort-zone-keynote-speaker/

The best parts of life happen outside your comfort zone. If you want to thrive, you need to grow. But change is hard!

Too often, people get stuck in the comfort zone, and shy away from the unfamiliar. Individuals, teams and organizations stagnate when they struggle to embrace change.

That’s where we come in. We are Dr. Dan Wendler and Dr. Kyler Shumway, two clinical psychologists (and best friends). With over a decade of keynote speaking experience, we specialize in creating impactful events that balance high energy and psychological insights you can really use.

Our keynote, “Outside Your Comfort Zone” gives your audience the courage to grow. It’s a bombastic one-hour experience that includes personal growth, practical strategies, and (of course) a dance montage. It equips your audience to adapt to change and move outside the comfort zone – without burning out.

#keynotespeaker #comfortzone #changemanagement #embracechange

Title: How to use your autistic special interest to grow as a person
Description:
If you're autistic, you already know how much joy and happiness can come from your special interest. But did you know that special interests can also help you grow?

Today I’m sharing with you how your autistic special interests can help you develop new skills and even connect with others. In this video we’ll take a closer look at why special interests are often one of the most important parts of personal growth for neurodivergent people. And, I'll talk about how my own special interests helped me become the psychologist I am today.

#Autistic #specialinterest #neurodivergent #Autism #autismacceptance  #Neurodiversity

0:00 Introduction
0:45 How do special interests help autistic people?
4:41 Use your interests in your social life
7:13 Conclusion

Title: Dr. Daniel Wendler - Psychologist Keynote Speaker
Description:
Book Dr. Dan to speak at your event - https://www.danielwendler.com/speaking

Dr. Daniel Wendler is a best-selling author, nationally recognized keynote speaker, and a proudly autistic clinical psychologist.  He speaks on neurodiversity, burnout, belonging, and escaping the comfort zone.

Dr. Dan is the author of three books, a two-time TEDx speaker, and the co-author of the Great Courses Audible lecture series "Neurodiversity and the Myth of Normal." He speaks and consults for leading organizations including Google, Accenture, and the US Treasury Department, and his expertise has been featured by Bloomberg Magazine, the American Psychological Association, and the Great Place to Work Summit.

Selected talks:

* Neurodiversity in the Workplace: https://www.danielwendler.com/neurodiversity-keynote-speaker/
* Outside The Comfort Zone & Embracing Change: https://www.danielwendler.com/comfort-zone-keynote-speaker/
* Plus - overcoming burnout, making friends, and more!

#keynotespeaker #sizzlereel #professionalspeaker

Title: Your ‘Failures’ Aren’t Random (Or All That Personal): Understanding Yourself as a Complex System
C-PTSD & The 'Get-Healed-Quick' Trap: How Fantasy Keeps Us Dysregulated (And Reality Heals)
C-PTSD & Nervous System Debt: The Hidden Costs Of Living With Chronic Dysregulation
How shame holds autistic people back (and what we can do about it)
Description:
Shame sucks. It stops us from feeling pride in our talents or celebrating our victories, because it whispers "You're still not good enough."

And shame can be especially vicious for those of us who are autistic, or who have another form of neurodivergence like ADHD. We see neurotypical folks breezing through a challenge that we struggle with, and shame whispers "You should be more like them."

Well, I'm here to tell you that shame is wrong. There's nothing wrong with you, and it's okay that some things are harder for you than they are for someone else. That's just a part of what it means to be neurodivergent; we get peaks and valleys. 

That's why I made this video - so you know what to do when shame comes knocking.

#autism #shame #selfconfidence #selflove #neurodiversity #neurodivergent #autism #autismacceptance 

00:00 - My embarrassing story
02:29 - Strengths and weaknesses in autism
03:27 - Why autistic struggles cause shame
04:12 - How shame keeps you stuck
06:00 - Regaining your confidence
07:45 - Leaving shame behind
08:38 - The truth about failure

Title: How to Know If Someone Actually Wants to Talk to You (60 Second Social Skills)
Description:
Not sure if someone actually wants to talk to you?
In this quick 60-second video, I will teach you how to spot the signs that someone is open to a conversation. It’s not always obvious, but this small thing can tell you a lot!

If you’ve ever second-guessed approaching someone or felt unsure in social situations, this tip will help you read the room with more confidence and avoid awkward moments. Perfect if you're trying to improve your communication skills, make new friends, or just feel more at ease in conversations.

#SocialSkills #ConversationTips  #CommunicationTips #MakeFriends #BetterConversations #PersonalGrowth #socialanxiety

Title: How to make new friends at the gym (without being creepy!)
Description:
Going to the gym is actually one of the best ways to make new friends - if you know how. There's no reason to feel awkward at the gym, or strike up a conversation in a creepy way - you just need to know the right techniques.

In this video, I’m talking about why the gym is such an underrated place to build real friendships, how to break the ice without it being weird, and simple ways to connect with people who are already into the same things you are.

Whether you're new to the gym or just looking to expand your social circle, this one’s for you.

#GymFriends #socialskills  #FitnessCommunity #SocialTips #GymLife #howtomakefriends
